result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution worksheet.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Londell Gray in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based on defendant's completion of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participation Contract and on motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on Motion of the State,  Court ordered the following Restitution amounts converted FORTHWITH to a civil judgment,  subject to Tax intercept.

1.)  LORA M. for FIVE HUNDRED SIXTY-ONE DOLLARS ($561.00).
2.)  LISA A. for NINE HUNDRED EIGHTY-NINE DOLLARS AND FORTY-SEVEN CENTS ($989.47).

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant TWO (2) points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for August 25, 2017 at 09:30 am.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TURNED OVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT.  UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO REVERT TO $250.00 CASH BOND (PREVIOUSLY POSTED).  Review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Londell Gray in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Londell Gray in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  COURT CORRECTED THE RESTITUTION AMOUNT TO REFLECT THE CORRECT AMOUNT OWED.
Defendant was NOT produced.  Matter is ADJOURNED to 08-24-2016 at 02:30 pm for further Proceedings.  sdg
Defendant has been accpeted into DTC/DPA.  Matter is adjourned to Br. 33 for further Proceedings.  sdg
Received call from Attorney Jeremy Arn requesting to adjourn today's Status conference to September 15, 2016 at 8:30.   clw

The Court's calendar had this case down for July 12, 2016.  Counsels had this case down for July 13, 2016.  Parties requested an adjournment as Defendant gets sentenced in Ozaukee County on July 21, 2016 and parties wanted to wait until that sentencing was done before they proceeded with this case.  Matter set for a status conference on August 15, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 18, Judge Colon's court.
